comments_since_last_sample.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

"How are you?"
"Fine, how are you?"
"Fine. I want a burger and fries with a coke."
"Ok, that's $9.67, cash or charge."

Are you talking about this?
I usually say something like "How's work going?"
Any other profession other than food service, fuck em
Compliment their attitude and how they carry themselves in such a positive way. that will make their entire day.

my dad was always so good at engaging servers. as a kid, i found it embarrassing, but now i know that by using people’s names and making real conversation is a much better way to interact since servers are, yknow, people.
This LPT seems like a special case of one of the big ones that too many people sadly forget: be decent to the people you interact with, no matter how important or lowly you consider them to be.
When customers asks me how my day is going I am never honest because I’d rather not be there dealing with annoying customers. But I’m told that’s not good customer service.
It is unwise to do this in France, because they get very miffed if you mess up the order of the greetings

Their response: it sucks.

My response: Oh no, tell me about it.

Other people in line: gtfo of the line
